Cancer.description: Cancer refers to the uncontrolled growth and spread of abnormal cells in the body. It is a complex disease that requires a multi-faceted approach for treatment. Here are some commonly used methods for curing cancer:

Surgery.description: Surgery is a common method used for the treatment of cancer. It involves the removal of abnormal cells or tumors from the body.
keywords: Removal of abnormal cells or tumors

Chemotherapy.description: Chemotherapy is a treatment method for cancer that involves the use of drugs to kill or slow down the growth of cancer cells. It is one of the most common and widely used treatments for cancer.
keywords: Kills or slows down the growth of cancer cells

Radiation therapy.description: Radiation therapy is a common treatment method for cancer that involves the use of high-energy radiation to destroy or shrink cancer cells.

Immunotherapy.description: Immunotherapy is a form of cancer treatment that uses the body's own immune system to fight cancer cells. It involves the use of substances or treatments that stimulate or enhance the immune system's response to target and destroy cancer cells.

Targeted therapy.description: Targeted therapy is a specialized approach to treating cancer that focuses on blocking specific molecules or pathways involved in the growth and survival of cancer cells. Unlike traditional chemotherapy, which affects both normal and cancerous cells, targeted therapy aims to selectively attack cancer cells while minimizing harm to healthy cells.

Precision medicine.description: Precision medicine refers to an approach that takes into account individual variability in genes, environment, and lifestyle for the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases like cancer.

Alternative medicine.description: Alternative medicine refers to practices and treatments that are outside the realm of conventional medicine. It often involves approaches that are not widely accepted or supported by scientific evidence.

Supportive care.description: Supportive care refers to the range of services and treatments provided to cancer patients to help manage symptoms, minimize side effects of treatment, improve quality of life, and provide emotional and psychological support.
